roles.name: Computer Vision and Machine Learning Lead Engineer

challenges.description: From research to production, implement enterprise ready solutions using Computer Vision, Deep Learning and Machine Learning.

Creator, editor and presenter of articles, books, and videos at **[RayWenderlich.com](https://www.raywenderlich.com/),** the premier tutorial site for mobile developers.

*   Co-author of **_[iOS Apprentice, 8th edition](https://store.raywenderlich.com/products/ios-apprentice/)_**, RayWenderlich.com’s “flagship” book. Completely revised two major sections of the book to cover developing apps using the SwiftUI framework. Rewrote two of the four apps presented in the book to reflect the new material. Co-wrote both the 2019 and 2020 editions.
*   Author and presenter of **_[Beginning ARKit](https://www.raywenderlich.com/737368-beginning-arkit/)_**, a video course covering augmented reality app development for iOS devices. Designed and developed 4 original apps for this course.
*   Technical editor of **_[ARKit by Tutorials](https://store.raywenderlich.com/products/arkit-by-tutorials/)_**, a book covering augmented reality app development for iOS devices.
*   Presenter: The only speaker at the RWDevCon 2018 conference to do 2 presentations: **[a two-hour introductory presentation on ARKit](https://www.raywenderlich.com/5156-rwdevcon-2018-vault/lessons/13),** and an in-depth four-hour workshop on the same topic. Became the highest-rated speaker at the conference, based on their attendee survey.
*   Android article author:
    *   **_[Augmented Reality in Android with Google’s Face API](https://www.raywenderlich.com/523-augmented-reality-in-android-with-google-s-face-api)_**
    *   **_[What’s New in Kotlin 1.3](https://www.raywenderlich.com/3871338-what-s-new-in-kotlin-1-3)_**
    *   **_[Kotlin Cheat Sheet and Quick Reference](https://www.raywenderlich.com/6649-kotlin-cheat-sheet-and-quick-reference)_**

In my spare time, to keep my hand in “the programming game”, I take on mobile app development side projects for people with interesting app ideas. My primary development platform is iOS, although I can also develop Android apps, as well as cross-platform apps using Xamarin. Recent projects include:

*   [Aspirations Winery’s Wine Crush](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/aspirations-winerys-wine-crush/id1131103492?mt=8): A free iOS app written to promote a friend’s winery and wine shop in Clearwater, Florida. It’s a wine-themed game in the style of Candy Crush, and a promotional tool that other wineries won't have. It's available for free on the App Store. Unlike other free games, there aren't any "poison pills" to extract money from players — this game's just about simple, unadulterated fun. • Mind Quieting, an audio player that guides the user through mind quieting exercises developed by Dr. Alan Banack, a Toronto-based psychotherapist, and based on techniques developed over years of working with patients to help counter stress.
asdasd

Technical lead for the front-end team (focused on Angular apps). Design and development of the workflow and tools to ease the day-to-day work of the team (linters, testing, CI, git...). Reinforcement of good practices. And, of course, development of Angular apps.

Cross-platform mobile developer for **[Lilypad](https://www.lilypad.co/)**, a sales tool and CRM app for the beverage alcohol industry.

*   Owned and delivered a major upgrade to the [Android version of Lilypad](https://play.google.com/store/apps/details?id=com.lilypadsolutions.lilypadappV2&hl=en_US), bringing it to feature parity with the iOS version. I was also working on improving the performance of the Android version so that it would be on par with the [iOS version](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/lilypad-sales/id921371352). Cleaned up the Android user interface and started making performance improvements that made some features 60% faster.
*   Fixed bugs, upgraded existing capabilities, and added new features to the app. Built apps for both iOS and Android in JavaScript using [Axway’s](https://www.appcelerator.com/) [Titanium](https://www.appcelerator.com/Titanium/) SDK (formerly known as Appcelerator Titanium).
*   Took charge of internal developer documentation. While Lilypad’s back end and web application were written by senior developers, the mobile app’s 360,000+ lines of source code were largely written by junior developers and interns. With managerial approval, devoted 20% of development time to writing much-needed internal documentation of the mobile app, refactoring the code, and upgrading it to a more current version of JavaScript.
*   Established coding standards for the mobile app. The mobile code was developed by a series of junior developers, each coding in their own style. Defined a standard to be used for mobile development and have applied it to the codebase during development.
*   Built a new mobile process and team: Key participant in weekly mobile development strategy meetings with the CTO to improve the mobile app development process. Interviewed developers for the mobile team.
TBD
Leading the Core 3D Model Generator, focus on improving and extend it with R&D approaches.

Provided technical, strategic, and customer management leadership to Sourcetoad as the company was entering a phase in which it takes on larger clients, more complex projects, and new markets.

Gathered requirements, wrote specifications, and product managed a number of applications, including:

*   Note-taking web application for pharmacists conducting reconciling patient’s medications in online interviews.
*   Mobile app where customers submit photos of prescriptions and participating pharmacies respond with offers and prices for the submitted prescriptions.
*   Investor-facing “Crunchbase for pharma” web application that tracks companies, conferences, executives, and researchers in the pharmacology and healthcare industries and the relations among them using a unique graph navigation system.
*   iPad-based self-serve kiosk for shipping via FedEx, UPS, or USPS.
*   Mobile app that allows general contractors to rate their customers on their interactions and payments.
*   Mobile app for the construction industry that tracks tickets for the delivery and removal of construction material from sites.

Sales, marketing, and community relations:

*   Actively participated in sales meetings, showcasing its application development capabilities and strengths to prospective clients. This led to a number of contract signings, including those for the projects list above.
*   Delivered several technical talks as an official Sourcetoad representative, including talks on data science, machine learning, and alternative programming platforms.
*   Represented Sourcetoad at various events they sponsored, including [BarCamp Tampa Bay](https://barcamptampabay.org/), [Tampa Hospitality Hackathon](https://www.sourcetoad.com/cruise/hack-hospitality-cruise-challenge-winners/), and [DevFest Florida](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=epfM9isTmK8).
*   [Narrated the video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zuKPwOjHNsY) for Sourcetoad’s flagship software product, Cruise Director.
*   Grew the company’s Twitter profile tenfold, and wrote several articles for the company blog.
*   Helped develop the company’s guidelines for interacting with clients.

I am in charge of the planification, estimation and development of a strategical new product for the company. Leading a development group of high skilled engineers. Reporting directly to the CEO.
The project is based on Microsoft Technology stack: JS/TypeScript/Jquery/Bootstrap/C#/EntityFramework/SQL Server as BD engine. Advanced tools used Ninject, Automapper, Nunit and Moq ﴾TDD﴿ and SpecFlow for BDD. RabbitMQ to manage communication among services and JS cllients.
I have implemented SCRUM with a two week sprint supported by JIRA, with GIT as a source code control and Bamboo as Continous Integration and Build server, all is connected with JIRA and Confluence.

Coaching the CRM team in order to guarantee the quality of the international version of the CRM and introducing agile techniques to increase the productivity and communication of the team. Reporting directly to the CEO.

Leader of the 3D and new projects development. Group of 2 internal and 6 external developers. Acting as scrum master for the projects. R&D, mobile and 3D projects were on my responsibility. Planning and managing resources were on my duties.

Development of new products using 2D and 3D data and the conversion between both. Using cutting technology inside a multinational company. Coordination among outsourced developers and the core team. The result were an impact on cost and resources for the whole company.

Computer Graphics and Computer Vision Assistant Professor.
Computer Science Subjects: · Programming Languages ﴾Grade on Telecommunication﴿ · Data Bases ﴾Master on Telecommunication ﴿ · Computer Architectures ﴾Master on Computer Science﴿ · Operative System ﴾Grade on Telecommunication ﴿ · Advanced Programming ﴾Grade on Telecommunication﴿

R+D Projects: nationals and internationals R+D projects about computer graphics, advanced graphics algorithms development, GPU programming, haptic interactions and collision detection, the requirements of the software comes from industrial and medical areas. Combination of the research work with teaching on computer science, focus on programming, data base and architecture matters.
Implementation facts: C/C++, OpenGL, Visual C++, STL, GLSL, CUDA, QT.; Development of Software to manage interaction with Haptics and meshes. Involved in the full‐cycle of the implementation phase, from requirements analysis to go live. Coordinating the research group. Discuss issues with medical experts and users.

Front-end lead developer.

- Converting from PSD/Fireworks designs to HTML/CSS code and then into the template system of choice (JSF, OpenCms, Drupal…)
- Developing Javascript libraries and jQuery plugins for richer UI experience
- Collaborating on development of internal framework for the team, defining UI and tools to make my team-mates happier
- Developing cross-platform mobile apps with tools like PhoneGap or Appcelerator Titanium
- Developing mobile apps using native SDKs
Programming and maintenance of web apps (ASP.NET, HTML, CSS, Javascript) taking special care on developing according to the W3C standards.

Regional, nationals ﴾INBIOMED﴿ and internationals ﴾Maestro6﴿ are R+D projects about computer vision, tracking, register, medical image processing, real time and advanced graphics algorithms development, the requirements of the software comes from de industrial and medical areas. Implementation facts: C/C++, VTK, OpenGL, GLUT, GLUI, UML, Visual C++, STL, MatLab
Development of Software to process Medical Images as CT ,MRI, etc.
Involved in the full‐cycle of the implementation phase, from requirements analysis to go live.
Coordinating the research group.
Discuss issues with medical experts and users.
